msContents.summary: The second of three complete volumes bound in two (together with Persian MS 897 (Vol. 1) of the Siyar al-Mutaʼakhkhirīn (Review of Modern Times), a general history of the Indian empire after the death of the Mughal Emperor ‘Alamgīr I in 1707‏ until 1195 AH (1781 CE).

author.persName: Ghulām Husain Khān, Ṭabaṭāḅāī, b. 1727 or 8
غلام حسين بن هدايت علی خان بن السيد عليم الله بن السيد فيض الله الطباطبائی الحسينی

msItem.title: Siyar al-mutaʼakhkhirīn
سير المتأخرين
msItem.incipit: برگ ۱پ (folio 1b): سپاس بیقیاس و ستایش سر اساس نثار بیار گاه عزت و عظمت و جلال‌ دادار بیهمالیست.
msItem.explicit: برگ ۴۷۸ر (folio 478a): سنه خمس وتسعين من المائة الثانيه عشرة من الهجره المقدسة النبوية علي صاحبها السلام والتحية.
msItem.colophon: برگ ۴۷۸ر (folio 478a): در سنه یکهزار و دوصد و بیست و چهار هجری صورت انجام و پیرایه یافت.

supportDesc.support: Medium-weight, straight-grained ivoury-coloured English handmade paper, with >1mm between the laid lines and ~26 mm between chain lines, Britannia and J. Whatman 1808 watermarks, of the Whatman paper mill in Maidstone, Kent, then owned and operated by William Balston (1759–1849). Endleaves of comparatively heavy English handmade paper, >1mm between laid lines and 30 mm between chain lines. Folios 257–258 are replaced with English handmade paper watermarked with Britannia and Budgen and Willmott 1811 watermarks of Kent papermakers Thomas Budgen and Charles Willmott, with chain lines 26 mm and laid lines ~1mm apart. Folios 405–412 are replaced with English handmade paper with Britannia and C. Brenchley 1812 watermarks, with chain lines 25 mm and laid lines >1mm apart. Endleaves of comparatively heavy British handmade paper, with laid lines ~1mm and chain lines 30 mm apart.

foliation.p: Foliated on folios 1b to 280b in Hindu-Arabic numerals inscribed on the upper-right corners of the b sides in black ink; however, folios 194 and 255 are duplicated.
Foliation in pencilled Arabic numerals on the upper-right corners of the a sides by the cataloguer.

supportDesc.collation: Possibly binions throughout. Catchwords thoughout on the lower left corners of the b sides.
supportDesc.condition: In good condition, with however the binding is somewhat tight and doesn't open to the gutters.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in a single column with 22 lines per page. Ruled with a miṣṭārah hand guide.

handDesc.handNote: Copied in clear nasta‘liq script in black ink with subheaders and marks in red.
Folios 257–258 and 405–412 replaced, written in a different nasta‘liq script in black ink, possibly the same hand that wrote several marginal notes.

list.item: Inscription:folio 305b 1st vol. 304 leaves Vol. 1 is very rare 3/? £2-10-0.
Bookplates: left paste-down, Bibliotheca Lindesiana with shelfmark 2/B, and Persian 103–104.

binding.p: Sewn at three stations, probably on sawn-in cord supports laced or frayed out onto the pasteboards. Edges finely speckled in blue and black. Folded striped red and white fabric stuck-on endbands applied at head and tail. Covered in an British-style, tight backed binding in full British tan coloured calfskin leather, with a smooth spine and defined joints, untitled and untooled.

decoNote.p: Calf boards spattered and marbled to the book by the binder after covering.

provenance.p: Subsequently acquired by Alexander Lindsay, 25th Earl of Crawford (1812–1880).

history.provenance: Purchased by Enriqueta Rylands (1843–1908) in 1901 from James Ludovic Lindsay, 26th Earl of Crawford (1847–1913).

acquisition.p: Bequeathed by Enriqueta Rylands (1843–1908) in 1908 to the John Rylands Library.

source.p: Bibliographical description based on an index created by Reza Navabpour circa 1993, derived from a manuscript catalogue by Michael Kerney, circa 1890s and his Bibliotheca Lindesiana, Hand-list of Oriental Manuscripts: Arabic, Persian, Turkish, 1898.
Manuscript description by Jake Benson in 2021 with reference to the volume.

availability.p: The manuscript is available for consultation by any accredited reader, see Becoming a Reader for details. Please contact uml.special-collections@manchester.ac.uk for further information on the availability of this manuscript.
